_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled



Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC (Stolthaven) is a for-hire public bulk liquid storage and transfer facility, located adjacent to the Mississippi River at Mile Marker 80 on the left descending bank.   The facility receives, stores, and transfers a wide variety of bulk liquid materials including food grade oils, fuels, solvents, and industrial chemicals.  Bulk products are stored in aboveground storage tanks surrounded by secondary containment sized to contain a complete failure of the largest tank and rainfall associated with the 25 year, 24 hour storm event within the containment area.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies 



Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC is committed to operating in a safe and compliant manner. 

Employees involved in operating the 1,3-Pentadiene handling facility are trained to identify and understand the hazards posed during the storage and transfer process.  Training includes the review of information pertaining to the hazards of 1,3-Pentadiene , process technology, process equipment, and emergency response procedures. The facility maintains written process safety information to enable employees involved in handling 1,3-Pentadiene to identify and understand the hazards posed by these processes.  Written training information includes the physical properties of 1,3-Pentadiene , the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.  Process safety and emergency response materials are kept on site and periodically reviewed.



Regulated Substances Handled 



Stolthaven handles more than the threshold quantities of 1,3-Pentadiene  (20,000 pounds). Stolthaven is regulated under the Program 2 requirements of 40 CFR 68.10.



Accidental Release Prevention Program  



Stolthaven's accidental release prevention program includes all the elements required under Part 68 Subpart C including, Safety Information 68.48; Hazard Review 68.50; Operating

Procedures 68.52; Training 68.54; Maintenance 68.56; Compliance Audits 68.58; and Incident Investigation 68.60.  Employees are provided with written training information which includes the physical properties of 1,3-Pentadiene , the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.



The five-year accident history 



The facility has never had an accident involving the covered chemical.  



Stolthaven has an Integrated Contingency Plan which outlines the coordination with local agencies in the event of spill or release.  



The Stolthaven facility was inspected by Louisiana Workforce Commission on May 5th, 2015.



Planned changes to improve safety 



Planned changes include continuous Safety Training for employees.
